result.execSummary:
The defendant Shalone L. Burns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent on Ct 1, Ct 2 and Ct 3 as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Bond applied.   Remaining fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with Maria Gonzalez Landeros  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Exception, they may have phone contact for reasons of child visitation/placement and within the next 30 days phone contact also allowed for property issues.  Agent can modify this if they think it is appropriate.  The contact can be stopped by the agent or if the victim requests it.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

The defendant shall have no contact with M.G.G.L.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant is not to be on or around the premises of 215 S 1st Street, Colby, WI.  Defendant may go through a third party to make arrangements for retrieval of personal property and for child visitation not more than 3 times a week..
AMENDED 07/22/2015 - Defendant may have no more than 4 telephone contacts with the victim and only for the discussion of exchanging child, no other topics to be discussed.  Defendant may have incidental contact during picking up or dropping off the child no more than 3 visitation periods or no more than 6 contacts total for a week; only the child is to be discussed during these contacts, no other topics.
AMENDED 10/01/2015 to $1000 cash bond, defendant needs to post an additional $350.00 to be released.

Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Shalone L. Burns appeared, pro se  Defendant was advised of right to attorney and waived that right  at this time.  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
